page.title: 07POLITICS IN IRELAND
page.content: Nowadays, the local politicians meet to conduct business in the Assembly Chamber.This assembly has no powers but can make recommendations.The main parties meet twice a week.They are the Official Unionist Party, the Democratic Unionist Party and the Alliance Party. Seventy - eight members are entitled to attend but only fifty - nine take their seats as the S.D.L.P. do not take part. There is another chamber where the Senat used to meet. This room is used for committee meetings. During the Second World War it was used as an operations room by the R.A.F. It contains an inscription to that effect.
